title: Senior Engineer Automation & Digitalization (m/f/d) bei ANDRITZ | karriere.at
text: Senior Engineer Automation & Digitalization (m/f/d) Company: ANDRITZ AG Location: Graz, Styria, AT; Raaba, Styria, AT; Vienna, Vienna, AT Job ID: 7898en_US ANDRITZ. Where passion meets career.Every day, ANDRITZ continues to deliver successful innovative solutions to our customers globally. Why are we so successful? Because we are passionate and love what we do! We are at the forefront of future engineering technologies, with solutions that ensure the success of our clients in key industries that are shaping the future of the world we live in. In the Pulp & Paper - Automation & Digitalization department in Graz, Vienna or Raaba, we are looking for a Senior Engineer Automation & Digitalization (m/f/d). Your Tasks Develop and implement new optimization solutions (e.g. advanced controls, machine learning and big data analytics) for customer projects in pulp & paper & panel board industry Work closely with product management and RnD to implement and further enhance new controls products and solutions Data analysis of process data to identify improvements potentials and bottlenecks at our customer projects Support automation optimization service contracts on site Execute optimization projects through their complete life cycle, from start up, through optimizing to monitoring in close collaboration with our customer Consolidate projects reports and project documentation Supports sales project management in customer meetings Your Profile Complete higher technical education (MSc TU/FH or HTL with work experience > 5 years) in Automation and control or electric engineering Intermediate Knowledge in automation and control (PID Controller, tuning of control loops, advanced process controls) Intermediate knowledge of instrumentation. Intermediate knowledge of electrics Basic knowledge of the industrial process you’ll work on is an advantage Intermediate Level English and German Advanced Working Knowledge of Microsoft Office Team player, trustworthy, autonomous working and good communication skills Strong organizational skills, flexibility to work in different projects and under a tight time schedule Availability to travel (50%) Our OfferAndritz AG offers a secure job in an innovative and international company with long-term development opportunities. Talent & leadership programs Flexible working time model Home office option Various employee discounts Subsidized company restaurant Parking spaces & public accessibility In Austria we are legally obliged to announce at least a gross monthly salary of € 3.928,71 for this position.Depending on qualifications and professional experience we offer you a market-based salary. Apply now »

title: Senior Product Designer (UX/UI Design) (m/f/x) bei Kaleido AI GmbH | karriere.at
text: Senior Product Designer (UX/UI Design) (m/f/x) - Kaleido AI Vienna / Design / Full-time Canva’s Commitment and Mission At Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. Our mission at Kaleido as part of Canva is to empower the world to design with AI and to democratize visual AI by creating easy-to-use visual AI tools for individuals and businesses of all sizes, enjoyed by more than 100+ million monthly users from 200+ countries. Our engineering team's tag-line: “We fail fast” - Dynamic processes, implementing new ideas, trying, failing, and improving rapidly. The world of tech is ever-evolving, and so are we. In this role, you'll own the whole design process: from creating concepts with the team to designing in accordance with our design system and validating them by conducting user tests. You will play a major role in bringing our market-leading background removal solutions to the next level. Your Tasks Team up with the Product Owner and the engineers to define and articulate the product strategy and vision for the future of remove.bg and unscreen.com. Work hand-in-hand with leading machine learning experts to define how we translate advanced technology to easy-to-understand user experiences. Be the key contact for Kaleido's design system and work closely with the engineers when it comes to updating or creating new components. Gather findings to iterate through the use of research to create the most impactful experience. Work closely with our Data Analysts to understand usage and user behavior, to make informed decisions Requirements You've at least 6 years of experience in end-to-end product design and shipped multiple products or features across a variety of platforms. You are able to design "pixel-perfect" prototypes in software like Figma and you know the value of documenting your concepts, processes, and studies. You are passionate about working with ML & AI and excited about the possibilities and the future of it. You have a keen visual eye and enjoy defining the details of UI that can translate across millions of users in hundreds of countries. You value the backing of research and data analysis when it comes to design. Benefits Work in one of the fastest-growing visual AI startups in Austria surrounded by like-minded people. Our visual AI products are industry-leading solutions that are easing the life of more than 25 million people globally every month. We are a part of the Canva family. Our collaboration with teams around the globe supercharges our work to empower the world to design. Canva’s success story is unique - and you benefit from it by participating in the company stock option program. Join an international team in Vienna (more than 65 people from 25 nationalities) and collaborate with lots of smart, like-minded people who love to ship quickly and you get to know the space of visual AI. Watch this video to learn more about our engineering organization - a tech talk given by your future coach/manager at Kaleido. You will have a flexible work schedule of 38.5h/week and a no-all-in contract. Work remotely, from our office located in Vienna's 3rd district, or mix-and-match. We can easily find an option that works best for you and Kaleido. We care about our employees and we believe mental health should be a priority, just like taking care of our bodies and staying in shape. We provide mental health support through an online platform specialized in professional counseling. Your lunch and your commute with Wiener Linien are on us. You can also find unlimited snacks, coffee, and beverages in our office. You receive a yearly allowance for professional education & personal well-being as well as additional leave days for volunteering. We organize regular (international) events at the company & team levels to foster team bonding. We are required by law to state the minimum salary for this position, which is at least EUR 54,000 gross per year. We pay competitive salaries - depending on your qualifications and experience - and you also get to participate in the company’s stock option program. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you! Join us and design your future. Apply for this job

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Frontend focus) (m/f/d) bei Sportradar Austria | karriere.at
text: Senior Fullstack Engineer (Frontend focus) (m/f/d) OVERVIEW: Sport provides people with a common connection - it can bring together and unite people from all walks of life and all corners of the globe to share sporting moments. And ever since odds were laid on chariot racing in Ancient Rome, fans have appreciated the value of timely and accurate sports statistics and information. Sportradar addresses this need, understanding and leveraging the power of sports data and digital content to be the leading global provider of sports betting and entertainment products and services. We are NASDAQ-listed and are one of the fastest-growing sport-tech companies on the planet. Our division, “Sportradar ad:s” provides data-driven marketing and sponsorship services to the iGaming industry, designed to help deliver significant efficiency improvements for marketing investments. The ad:s team develops and provides purpose-built tools and services to meet the individual marketing needs of sportsbooks and media publishers worldwide. Imagine yourself working in surroundings of sports data, live play-by-play statistics, virtual sports, microservices, and betting – everything done in an agile spirit and always striving to deliver the most value for our customers. We are passionate about what we do, and we care passionately about our people. If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop! ROLE: As a Senior Full-Stack Engineer (Frontend Focus) at Sportradar ad:s, you will be tackling all aspects of the software stack. Become part of a cross-functional team and take on the responsibility of delivering functional excellence and value to the business. We’re looking for someone who loves working in a collaborative environment and likes to work on all aspects of the software stack, from API design to front-end UI. You will work as part of a small cross-functional team who has control on how to solve problems whether that is through architecting solutions or technologies. We use a mix of modern tools and languages and firmly believe in using the best tool for the job, e.g. Golang, Node.JS, Kubernetes, Vue, React, TypeScript, MongoDB and PostgresSQL. We utilise both Google Cloud Platform and AWS for our infrastructure and as Engineers we are responsible to fulfill the devops function with help and support from our Platform team. THE CHALLENGE: Building tools that allow us to scale to 5x scale of customers this year Helping our customers achieve ever-increasing campaign performance by optimizing the signals measured on their site Increasing our creative offering to market-leading levels Experimenting on new and emerging marketing platforms YOUR PROFILE: Requirements we’re looking for: 4+ years of full-stack development experience working as part of an agile/lean development team JavaScript knowledge, especially using React/Vue, TypeScript and Node.js Experience developing and operating microservices; health checks, load balancing, service discovery, metrics, etc. Familiarity with microservices, Kubernetes, and a DevOps culture Experience utilizing databases, SQL or NoSQL Deep understanding of approaches to testing You may also bring - or like to gain - skills in any of the following: Professional experience with Go (Golang) Optimization and scaling of microservices Machine Learning Google Cloud Platform Kubernetes In addition to these technical capability, we are looking for an individual who can show evidence of multiple of following: Has diverse technical competency (able to move between teams and contribute value) Able to communicate and influence within and outside of their immediate team Takes ownership of decisions made by themselves and anyone they line manage (maturity and ability to review/balance risks vs reward) Able to work in isolation and make positive decisions (ability to make positive contributions without direct management/supervision) Able to supervise the work of other more junior staff Able to manage their own priorities (can deliver when needed or provide context when a delivery cannot be met, due to competing work or insufficient resources (such as time)) Proactively works to improve process/practices and their own/team’s workflow and product and clarify understanding OUR OFFER Be part of one of the fastest-growing digital sports companies in the world at the intersection of sports, betting, and advertising Active participation in an end-to-end process of developing a brand new software used to create a fundamentally new business model Work together with a young, highly motivated, and enthusiastic core of people Exciting job field with the opportunity for personal development Home office and flexible working hours Team activities, darts and table tennis Tickets for sport events The minimum monthly salary for this position is according to the Collective Bargaining Agreement, overpayment will be considered depending on qualifications and working experience. Buckle up, hold on tight and get ready for an incredible adrenaline-rush throughout this exciting ride with us: #maketheteam and shape your future as well as ours! Sportradar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to encourage diversity within our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to among other things, your background, status, or personal preferences.

title: Performance Marketing Specialist SEA/SEO (m/w/x) - Focus AI bei craftworks GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Performance Marketing Specialist SEA/SEO (m/w/x) Focus AI Successful GROWTH is a DECISION - Driven by data
Are you ready to rock tomorrow's AI solutions with us? We are craftworks, a handpicked and diverse team of creative thinkers and implementers. We develop innovative products and individual software solutions for industrial companies in the fields of machine learning and big data. Leading companies like Verbund, FILL, Miba or Engel are already long-standing customers who trust our high-quality standards. In doing so, we inspire and promote growth - in every team member and in our customers through a very strong team spirit and a constant striving for the highest quality and performance. You can find more information about our culture and our collaborations on our website.
You should also take a look at our craftworks Culture Book and immerse yourself in the personal stories of our colleagues. YOUR FUTURE ROLE You are responsible for the implementation and ongoing optimization of SEA and SEO measures alongside our marketing team You enjoy creating and executing new concepts for performance marketing campaigns as well as optimizing new campaigns in terms of structure, bidding and ad copy quality in German and English You are enthusiastic about tracking trends and exchanging ideas within the marketing team You own existing user PPC acquisition channels (Google Ads) and identify, explore and provide new opportunities to sustainably grow our user base of our SaaS products You perform audits on our website to identify on-page optimization opportunities, technical issues and content improvements You are ready to create guidelines to ensure the site is built in an SEO-friendly way as well as internal reports and to execute internal research Your technical understanding helps you to come up with indication strategy improvements and to provide technical solutions for duplicate content issues, geo targeting and site architecture You perform large scale research on search intent, identify opportunities for organic growth and develop scalable and testable concepts for SEO content YOUR COMPETENCIES You have a least 2 years of professional experience in performance marketing and knowledge of Google Ads and SEO You are passionate about data-driven online marketing, a creative problem solver with strong analytical skills and great technical understanding Experience in technical SEO with skills in creating audits and in-depth SEO recommendations You have a well-founded knowledge of SEO concepts like search intent clustering, E-A-T, Core Web Vitals You have a good understanding of web assets like canonicals, response codes, sitemaps, HTML tags and their impact on crawling, indexation, and ranking English and German language proficiency required WE OFFER A pleasant working environment in a company that is all about its people Choose your working equipment of choice An interdisciplinary, international, agile team of exceptional minds Flexible working hours and hybrid working - choose between working in one of your offices or from home A Feedback Culture where you get to talk about your successes, expectations and next steps in professional and personal development An allowance for lunch as well as free drinks and snacks The opportunity and budget to constantly develop yourself and expand your competencies A really lively company culture: team trips, sport events, board games, FIFA tournaments, hackathons A mentoring program - you get your own Buddy which will guide you through the Onboarding-Phase Are you also striving for a positive Change? Then let's do it together!
Apply now and join a self organized team in Vienna. We look forward to receiving your application. The minimum salary for this position starts at € 45.000,- per year on a full time basis according to the IT collective agreement. Depending on your qualifications and professional experience, we offer a market-oriented overpayment.

title: Automatisierungstechniker (w/m/d) / Automation Engineer (f/m/x) bei Takeda Austria GmbH | karriere.at
text:
Über die Rolle:
Als Teil der Site Engineering Linz sind Sie im Team von Industrial Automation für die Automatisierung im Produktionsbereich verantwortlich. Dies betrifft dem gesamten Systemlebenszyklus; von der Einbindung in die IT-Infrastruktur über die Organisation des Betriebs bis hin zur Stilllegung der computerisierten Systeme. Im Bereich Visual Engineering sind Sie ein strategischer Partner bei der Implementierung neuer visueller Systeme bzw. bei der Optimierung unserer bestehenden Prozesse. Zur Unterstützung der Automatisierungsprojekte und Umsetzung unserer Digitalisierungsstrategie am Produktionsstandort Linz suchen wir technikbegeisterte, zukunftsorientierte und IT-affine Teamplayer. Automatisierungstechniker (w/m/d) / Automation Engineer (f/m/x) Das bewirken Sie: Verantwortung für den gesamten Lebenszyklus von Automatisierungs- bzw. Prozessteuerungs-Systemen und Komponenten in der pharmazeutischen Produktion Konzeption, Planung, Entwicklung und Teilprojektabwicklung bei Neu- und Bestandsanlagen Einführung, Betreuung und Optimierung von Produktions- und Inspektionsprozessen (OEE Optimierung, Machine learning, Reliabiltiy-KPIs) Kontinuierliche Optimierung der bestehenden Vision-Rezepte an den bestehenden Inspektionsmaschinen auf Basis der erhobenen OEE-Daten zur Reduzierung der „False Rejection Rate“ im Zusammenarbeit mit den Kamera Systemlieferanten Unterstützung bei Anlagenabnahmen beim Hersteller (FAT: Factory Acceptance Test) und vor Ort (SAT: Site Acceptance Test) Koordination und Unterstützung bei Inbetriebnahmen von IT- und Automatisierungskomponenten (Hard- und Software Komponenten SIMATIC, SCADA Systeme WinCC, Intouch) und Integration in die bestehende IT-Infrastruktur Unterstützung und Organisation des Betriebs von SCADA- und Prozessleitsystemen (PCS7) Mitarbeit bei der Validierung/Qualifizierung von Automatisierungssystemen GMP gerechte Dokumentation Dafür bringen Sie mit: Erfahrung in produzierenden Unternehmen mit Verpackungsmaschinen, Robotik sowie mit Inspektionssystemen Abgeschlossene technische Ausbildung in den Bereichen Automatisierung, EMSR, Informationstechnologie oder ähnliche mit Bezug zur Prozessautomatisierung Vertiefte Kenntnisse in der SPS-Programmierung (SIMATIC S7) und in der Konfiguration von Visualisierungs- und SCADA-Systemen (WinCC) Kenntnisse in der Netzwerktechnik und Virtualisierung von Servern Erfahrung mit Prozessleitsystem SIMATIC PCS7 wünschenswert Guter Umgang mit MS Office Produkten & Windows Betriebssystemen Gute fachspezifische Englischkenntnisse Reisebereitschaft im Zuge von Anlagenabnahmen (nur minimale Reisetätigkeit erforderlich) Das bieten wir Ihnen: Für diese wichtige und verantwortungsvolle Position beträgt das Mindestgehalt € 3,740,-- brutto/Monat (Vollzeit, KV chem. Industrie). Das tatsächliche Gehaltspaket richtet sich nach Ihrer Berufserfahrung und Qualifikation. Weitere Benefits: Familienfreundliches Unternehmen (z.B. betriebliche Kinderbetreuung und organisierte Ferienwoche für Kinder) Hybrides Arbeiten & flexible Zeiteinteilung wo möglich Firmeninterne Job Rotations im In- und Ausland Weiterbildungs- und -entwicklungsmöglichkeiten (z.B. Vorträge & Impuls-Workshops) Umfassende Trainings- und Fortbildungsprogramme Mitarbeiter*innenempfehlungs- und -anerkennungsprogramme Aktive Teilnahme an Netzwerkgruppen zu verschiedenen Themen (z.B. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Nachhaltigkeit und Innovation Gesundheitsangebote wie z.B. Pilates, Resilienz-Seminare oder Lauftraining Kostenlose Vorsorgeuntersuchungen & Impfaktionen, Psychologische Beratung Vergünstigung im Betriebsrestaurant sowie bei verschiedenen Handelspartnern Obsttage, gratis Kaffee und Tee Kostenloser Mitarbeiter*innenparkplatz Bezahlter Urlaub am Geburtstag Gute Anbindung an das öffentliche Verkehrsnetz Betriebsrat – Leistungen aus dem Betriebsratsfond Interessierten Menschen bieten wir zahlreiche Möglichkeiten. Geschlecht, Alter, Hautfarbe, Herkunft und sexuelle Orientierung spielen dabei keine Rolle, im Gegenteil: Wir fördern Vielfalt. Wir wenden uns gleichermaßen auch an Menschen mit Behinderung. Im Zuge eines möglichst barrierefreien Bewerbungsprozesses und um Gleichberechtigung zu verstärken, bitten wir Sie in Ihrer Bewerbung alle diesbezüglich relevanten Informationen anzugeben. Mehr über uns: In Österreich arbeitet Takeda entlang der gesamten pharmazeutischen Wertschöpfungskette: Forschung & Entwicklung, Plasmaaufbringung, Produktion und Vertrieb. Takeda ist der größte Pharmaarbeitgeber Österreichs. Rund 4.500 Mitarbeiter*innen tragen täglich dazu bei, dass Medikamente aus Österreich in die ganze Welt gelangen und Patient*innen in Österreich Zugang zu innovativen Arzneimitteln von Takeda erhalten. Die Entwicklungs- und Produktionsstandorte von Takeda befinden sich in Wien, Linz und Orth an der Donau. Mehr Infos über Takeda Linz und was uns als Top Employer auszeichnet erfahren Sie in diesen Videos.Hier finden Sie einen Einblick in Engineering bei Takeda in Österreich Empowering our people to shine: Unter dem Motto „Empowering our people to shine” hat sich Takeda zum Ziel gesetzt, alle Mitarbeiter*innen darin zu unterstützen, ihr Potenzial voll entfalten zu können. Dazu setzt Takeda für seine Mitarbeiter*innen ein breites Programm an Weiterbildungen, Förderungen, Benefits und flexiblen freiwilligen Leistungen um. Apply

title: Tech Lead & Development Manager (m/f/d) bei Sportradar Austria | karriere.at
text: Tech Lead & Development Manager (m/f/d) Sport provides people with a common connection - it can bring together and unite people from all walks of life and all corners of the globe to share sporting moments. And ever since odds were laid on chariot racing in Ancient Rome, fans have appreciated the value of timely and accurate sports statistics and information. Sportradar addresses this need, understanding and leveraging the power of sports data and digital content to be the leading global provider of sports betting and entertainment products and services. We are NASDAQ-listed and are one of the fastest-growing sport-tech companies on the planet. Our division, “Sportradar ad:s” provides data-driven marketing and sponsorship services to the iGaming industry, designed to help deliver significant efficiency improvements for marketing investments. The ad:s team develops and provides purpose-built tools and services to meet the individual marketing needs of sportsbooks and media publishers worldwide. Imagine yourself working in surroundings of sports data, live play-by-play statistics, virtual sports, microservices, and betting – everything done in an agile spirit and always striving to deliver the most value for our customers. We are passionate about what we do, and we care passionately about our people. If you think you’re up to the challenge, come and help us to grow, innovate and develop! THE ROLE: As a Technical Lead & Development Manager at Sportradar, you will be responsible for developing the right capabilities in the ad:s tribe, equipping Chapter members with the skills, tools and standard approaches to deliver functional excellence and value to the business. At the same time, the Chapter Lead is a practicing and hands-on Software Engineer themselves, working alongside other Engineers as part of a Squad. As Tech and Development Lead, you will be responsible for the line management and development of the people who are members of your Chapter. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for recruitment, development, performance management and retention of all Chapter members. Responsible for providing line management duties for all Chapter members with a view to focusing on coaching and mentoring techniques aligned with agile principles and values. Responsible for providing an inclusive environment where Chapter members have the freedom and safety to innovate, experiment, and learn from failure. Responsible for providing open and effective communication channels leading to greater knowledge transfer and alignment within the Chapter. Member of the Tribe’s Engineering Leadership group, contributing to topics such as: Operational concerns like Security, Incident Management, DevOps, Audit and Compliance Recruitment and Staffing Engineering Roadmap SDLC alignment and improvement plans Responsible for being the local point-of-contact, coordinating with the People Partner, Office Manager and IT Helpdesk, to represent, signpost and assist Engineers based locally in the same office to find support in matters relating to: Equipment and devices Physical and software access Personal issues New joiners YOUR PROFILE: Requirements we’re looking for: Full-stack development experience working as part of an agile/lean development team Familiarity with microservices, Kubernetes, and a DevOps culture Deep understanding of approaches to testing Proven track record successfully leading a development team Experience of line management responsibilities including recruitment, performance management and facilitating personal development Demonstrable experience managing and influencing stakeholders to set expectations and broker successful outcomes You may also bring - or like to gain - skills in any of the following Professional experience with Go (Golang) JavaScript knowledge, especially using React/Vue, TypeScript and Node.js Optimization and scaling of microservices Machine Learning Amazon Web Services Kubernetes In addition to these technical capabilities, we are looking for an individual who can show evidence of multiple of following Has diverse technical competency (able to move between teams and contribute value) Able to communicate and influence within and outside of their immediate team with a diverse set of stakeholders Takes ownership of decisions made by themselves and anyone they line manage (maturity and ability to review/balance risks vs reward) Able to work in isolation and make positive decisions (ability to make positive contributions without direct management/supervision) Able to supervise the work of other more junior staff Able to manage their own priorities and those of their team (can deliver when needed or provide context when a delivery cannot be met, due to competing work or insufficient resources (such as time)) Proactively works to improve process/practices and their own/team’s/tribe’s workflow and product(s) and clarify understanding Coaching and mentoring staff OUR OFFER: The opportunity to work and develop within an inspiring and fast-growing company The possibility to help shape the future of SportradarAll developers are directly contributing to products used by our clients in the global sports business. The opportunity to grow your skills (German and English courses, Sportradar eAcademy, Engineering workshops, Code Retreats, Randori styled Coding Kata) Involvement in shaping your own workday and career through a high degree of freedom to choose technology and your personal development path A collaborative environment with colleagues from all over the world (Engineering offices in Europe, Asia and US) A company culture that promotes social aspects, sports, physical exercise and fun. Innovative and cross-team challenges like ShipIt, office sports tournaments in Darts and Table Tennis and unique beer brewing competitions Competitive salary and benefits (e.g. retirement pension and insurance plan) Possibility to work from a home office when needed The total expected yearly compensation includes a fixed salary, a performance-based bonus component and access to our retention-based equity/stock program. For this position will be compensation between EUR 90.000 and EUR 115.000 with overpayments possible based on the candidate´s personal qualifications. You will get more details on our compensation framework in our personal conversations. Sportradar is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to encouraging diversity within our teams. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to among other things, your background, status, or personal preferences. Please let us know if you need any accommodation or support during the interview process and we will do our best to meet your needs.

title: Tech Lead & Development Manager (m/f/d) bei Sportradar Austria | karriere.at
text: Tech Lead & Development Manager (m/f/d) OVERVIEW: Sport gibt Menschen eine Verbindung. Er bringt Menschen aus unterschiedlichen Kulturen, unterschiedlichen Orten der Welt und mit unterschiedlichen Hintergründen zusammen. Und seitdem Quoten für Pferderennen im Alten Rom angeboten wurden, haben Fans den Wert von detaillierten und genauen Statistiken im Sport zu schätzen gelernt. Sportradar bietet mit seinen Dienstleistungen Lösungen für diesen Bereich – wir produzieren Content jeglicher Art – von einfachen Sportergebnissen zu hochkomplexen, AI-basierten Videoanlysetools – von über 400.000 Sportereignissen jedes Jahr. Das macht uns zum weltweiten Marktführer für Daten- und Entertainmentprodukte im Sport. Wir sind an der New Yorker NASDAQ gelistet und sind eines der am schnellsten wachsenden Sport-Tech Firmen der Welt. Unsere Bereich „Sportradar ad:s, für den wir Verstärkung suchen, bietet unseren Kunden aus dem Sport-, Medien- und Wettbereich technologiebasierte Marketinglösungen an, die es ihnen ermöglichen, ihr Marketing datenbasierter und damit effektiver und effizienter zu gestalten. Im Tech-Bereich arbeiten wir mit den neuesten Technologien in einem sehr agilen Umfeld, um einen Mehrwert für unsere Kunden zu schaffen. Wir tun das, was wir tun mit viel Leidenschaft – so sind uns auch unsere MitarbeiterInnen ein leidenschaftliches Anliegen. Wenn du glaubst, dass du bereit für eine neue Challenge bist, bewirb dich bei uns damit wir gemeinsam wachsen können! DIE ROLLE: Als Technical Lead & Development Manager bei Sportradar bist du dafür verantwortlich, ein Team von EntwicklerInnen zu führen. Dazu hilfst du deinem Team sich konstant weiterzuentwicklen in dem du sie dabei unterstützt sich technisch, organisatorisch und persönlich weiterzuentwicklen. Gleichzeitig bist du noch immer „hands-on“, selbst ein Software-Engineer, der auch operativ weiß, wie man einen guten Code schreibt. DIE HERAUSFORDERUNG: Verantwortung für die Performance eines EntwicklerInnen-Teams – dazu gehört das Management von bestehenden TeammitgliederInnen genauso wie das Recruiting von neuen MitarbeiterInnen. Verantwortung für das Line-Management innerhalb des Teams. Dazu gehört, neben administrativen Aufgaben, vor allem auch eine Kultur des Miteinanders zu schaffen und zu erhalten, in dem das Team sich wohlfühlt, neue Ideen einbringen und aus seinen Fehlern lernen kann. Mitglied im Führungsteam des „ad:s Tribe“ in dem aktive Mitsprache zu Themen wie: Security, Incident Management, DevOps, etc. Recruiting Roadmap Planung Compliance usw. erwartet wird. Lokaler Kontakt für HR, Office Management und IT Helpdesk, um dein Team zu unterstützen und im selben Office bei Themen wie: Equipment und Devices Zugang zu Software Persönlichen Themen etc. zu helfen. DEIN PROFIL: Professionelle Voraussetzungen, die du haben solltest: Full-stack Entwicklungs-Erfahrung Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit agilen Teams und Lean Development Wissen zu Microservices-Architektur und einer DevOps-orientierten Kultur Gutes Verständnis für Test-Driven-Development Erste Führungserfahrung (wenn auch nicht als direkter Line-Manager, dann zumindest in einer informellen Leadership-Rolle), vor allem im Bereich Recruiting, Performance Management und Teamentwicklung Bereitschaft, unterschiedliche Stakeholder zu managen, Erwartungen zu setzen und konkrete Erfolge zu erzielen. Dinge, die wir schätzen, die aber keine unbedingte Voraussetzung sind: Erfahrung mit der Programmiersprache Go (Golang) Wissen zu JaveSript, vor allem mit React und/oder Vue, TypeScripe und Node.js Optimierung und Skalierung von Microservices Erfahrung mit Machine Learning Erfahrung mit Amazon Web Services Erfahrung mit Kubernetes Zusätzlich zu deinen technischen Fähgikeiten wünschen wir uns, dass du folgende Eigenschaften besitzt: Ausgezeichnetes Englisch (Firmensprache und Haupt-Kommunikationssprache ist Englisch) Du kannst dich schnell in neue Teams einbringen und dort auch schnell Wert schaffen Du kannst innerhalb aber auch außerhalb deines Teams gut kommunizieren und hast auch Freude daran, dies zu tun Du bist bereit, die Verantwortung für Entscheidungen zu übernehmen, egal ob du sie selbst getroffen hast oder sie in dem Team, für das du verantwortlich bist, getroffen wurden. In diesen Entscheidungen gelingt es dir, Risiken und Chancen zu balancieren. Du arbeitest selbstständig, selbst-motiviert und zielorientert, auch ohne dass dein direkter Vorgesetzter dir ständig über die Schulter schaut. Du kannst deine eigenen Prioritäten und die deines Teams managen und du schaffst es, deine Ziele zu erreichen – auch wenn die Voraussetzungen nicht immer perfekt sind Du bist pro-aktiv und versuchst Prozesse auf das nächste Level zu heben und (Produkt)Verständnis innerhalb und außerhalb des Teams zu verbessern UNSER ANGEBOT: Sei ein Teil eines der am schnellsten wachsenden digitalen Sportunternehmen und arbeite an der Schnittstelle von Sport, Medien, Werbung und Wetten. Aktive Mitarbeit in einem end-to-end Prozess bei der Entwicklung einer brandneuen Software und bei der Umsetzung eines komplett neuen Business-Modells. Arbeit in einem jungen, hoch motivierten und sehr internationalen Team Möglichkeit, dich innerhalb des Teams aber auch innerhalb des Unternehmens persönlich weiterzuentwickeln Home-Office Möglichkeiten und flexible Arbeitszeiteinteilung Zahlreiche Team-Aktivitäten in- und außerhalb des Büros Darts, Billiard und Tischtennis im Büro Tickets für Sportveranstaltungen und zahlreiche sonstige Benefits. Das erwartete Gesamtbudget für die Stelle inkludiert ein Fixgehalt, einen leistungsorientierten Bonus und Zugang zu unserem attraktiven, auf Langfristigkeit orientierten, Equity/Aktienprogramm. Dafür ist eine Brutto-Gesamtjahresentlohnung zwischen EUR 90.000 und EUR 115.000 vorgesehen (bestehend aus all diesen Komponenten). Wenn du perfekt auf diese Stelle passt, ist eine Überzahlung möglich. Details zur Entlohnung, v.a. wie Bonus und Aktienprogramm funktionieren, erklären wir dir gerne in einem persönlichen Gespräch. Gib Gas, mach dich bereit für einen Adrenalinschub und komm mit uns auf eine spannende Reise! #maketheteam und forme deine persönliche Zukunft sowie unsere Zukunft als Unternehmen! Sportradar legt großen Wert auf gleiche Möglichkeiten für alle. Wir unterstützen daher Diversität in all unseren Teams. Alle qualifizierten Bewerberinnen und Bewerber werden ernst genommen und haben dieselben Chancen. Dein persönlicher Hintergrund, dein Status oder deine persönlichen Präferenzen haben keinen Einfluss auf unsere Entscheidungen.

title: Digitalization Engineer (f/m/d) bei ANDRITZ | karriere.at
text: Digitalization Engineer (f/m/d) Company: ANDRITZ AG Location: Graz, Styria, AT; Vierkirchen, DE Job ID: 6785de_DE International technology group ANDRITZ offers a broad portfolio of innovative plants, equipment, systems and services for the pulp and paper industry, the hydropower sector, the metals processing and forming industry, pumps, solid/liquid separation in the municipal and industrial sectors, as well as animal feed and biomass pelleting. Plants for power generation, flue gas cleaning, recycling, and the production of nonwovens and panelboard complete the global product and service offering. Innovative products and services in the industrial digitalization sector are offered under the brand name Metris and help customers to make their plants more user-friendly, efficient and profitable. The publicly listed group has around 27,400 employees and more than 280 locations in over 40 countries. In the Group Automation & Digitalization department in Graz or Vierkirchen, we are looking for a Digitalization Engineer (m/f/d). Your Tasks Responsible for Software Development through developing machine learning algorithms, building new models on existing libraries as well as testing and fine-tuning the models on customer side Responsible for the Technical sales support through providing technical content for presentations, analysis of customer requirements in the field of digital services, identifying potential customers and supporting sales during customer meetings with technical expertise Project management: responsible (completely or partly) for pre-defined R&D projects in the field of digital services or predictive maintenance Preparation of budgets, timelines, milestone-monitoring, review-meetings as well as the product launch Your Profile Successfully completed education (e.g. technical college, technical university studies) in the area of automation engineering, electrical engineering or electro-mechanical engineering Several years of professional experience Flexibility and self-directed initiative MS Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Fluency in both written and spoken English and German Excellent customer service skills, result orientation as well as good analytical thinking skills Team player with good communication and organizational skills We offer Andritz AG offers a secure job in an innovative and international company with long-term development opportunities. Talent & leadership programs Flexible working time model Home office option Various employee discounts Subsidized company restaurant Parking spaces & public accessibility In Austria we are legally obliged to announce at least a gross monthly salary of € 3.400,86 for this position.Depending on qualifications and professional experience we offer you a market-based salary. Apply now »

title: Consultant Business Analyse – Banken (all genders) bei Accenture | karriere.at
text: Consultant Business Analyse – Banken (all genders) Jobnummer R00144192 ViennaFull timeSenior Berufseinstieg Let there be change – zusammen mit DIR, gerne auch ohne Anzug oder Kostüm, aber mit dem unstoppbaren Willen im Team von Accenture Technology „Industry & Delivery” etwas zu verändern! Bei uns dreht sich alles um die IT-Transformation von nationalen und internationalen Top-Unternehmen. Dafür und für unsere „Delivery Excellence“ sind wir auf dem Markt bekannt. Warum uns die Big Player ihrer Branche als Partner für die ganz großen Transformationsvorhaben ins Boot holen? Weil sie sich darauf verlassen können, dass wir ihr Geschäft verstehen und wissen, wie man globale, nachhaltige End-to-End-Lösungen mit enormem Impact liefert und so für unsere Kunden einen 360-Grad-Wert schafft. Unsere Expertise reicht über den gesamten Financial Services-Bereich: Banken, Versicherungen sowie Capital Markets. Als Consultant mit Schwerpunkt Business Analyse für Top-Kunden in der Bankenbranche bist du Teil eines Teams, das die Einbindung innovativer Technologien bei namhaften Unternehmen begleitet – mit Themen wie maßgeschneiderte Plattformen, Daten- und Cloud-Migrationen, Microservices, Blockchain oder Data Analytics (AI, Machine Learning). Du willst deine Karriere im dynamischsten Marktumfeld aller Zeiten beschleunigen, die Welt in einen besseren Ort verwandeln und Teil eines sympathischen, diversen, interdisziplinären Teams aus hochmotivierten Expert:innen mit fantastischem Spirit werden? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Diese Position ist in Voll- und Teilzeit möglich. Das erwartet dich Du berätst nationale und internationale Top-Unternehmen bei ihrem digitalen Wandel sowie zum Thema Geschäftsprozessanalyse und Design von digitalen Lösungen. Zu diesem Zweck hast du das IT-Zielbild über den gesamten Softwarelebenszyklus immer auf dem Schirm. Klar, dass du bei der Entwicklung technischer Lösungen auf Grundlage der Kundenanforderungen mit einem Expert:innen-Team Hand in Hand arbeitest und neueste Technologien, wie z. B. Cloud, Data Analytics, SAP, Robotics Process Automation/Automatisierung und Virtual Reality, einbindest. In deiner Rolle tauschst du dich täglich mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern auf Kunden- und Accenture-Seite aus und identifizierst zukünftige Geschäftspotenziale. Darauf freuen wir unsAbgeschlossenes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation, vorzugsweise der BWL, Mathematik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Naturwissenschaften, Humanwissenschaften oder des Ingenieurwesens mit 3-4 Jahren Erfahrung in der Technologieberatung und/oder SystemintegrationBegeisterung für komplexe digitale Herausforderungen sowie für die Erarbeitung und Vermittlung entsprechender LösungenIdealerweise grundlegendes Wissen über Themen wie DevOps und agile Liefermethoden in der SoftwareentwicklungEine schnelle Auffassungsgabe, Abstraktionsvermögen, eine analytisch-konzeptionelle Denkweise sowie Kommunikationssicherheit auf Deutsch und EnglischDeine Vorteile bei AccentureDu als Mensch bist uns wichtig. Das wirst du täglich spüren und erleben. Unsere Arbeitswelt ist auf dich ausgerichtet und bietet dir die umfassenden Benefits eines großen, verantwortungsvollen Arbeitgebers. Dein zukünftiges Team schätzt vor allemunsere Arbeitskultur, die Diversität, Inklusion und einen herausragenden Teamspirit fördertflexible Arbeitszeitmodelle, mobiles Arbeiten und Homeofficeumfassende Trainingsangebote, Fort- und WeiterbildungsmöglichkeitenBegleitung und Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mentor:innen und Projektleiter:inneninteressante KarriereoptionenWir leben Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt. Bewerbungen von Kandidat:innen mit Behinderung sind explizit erwünscht.Dein KontaktDu hast Fragen? Dann wende dich gerne an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_austria@accenture.com.Neben spannenden Projekten bieten wir dir ein attraktives Vergütungspaket, flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein modernes Umfeld und viele weitere zusätzliche Benefits. Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, basierend auf deiner individuellen Leistung aktiv dein Jahreseinkommen positiv zu beeinflussen welches für diese Position bei einem Jahresbruttogehalt von € 49.000 startet.Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung! Bewerben InnovationsführerAccenture ist immer am Puls der Zeit. Wir gestalten die Digitalisierung aktiv mit, sind strategischer Vordenker und technologischer Vorreiter. So stärken wir Unternehmen und ganze Branchen. Weiterbildung und KarriereUnser Trainingsangebot reicht von Online-Kursen über virtuelle Trainings bis hin zu Classroom-Seminaren. Wir investieren jährlich über 800 Millionen US-Dollar in Mitarbeiterbildung. AufgabenvielfaltMehr Vielfalt geht kaum: Wir begleiten Kunden aus 40 Industrien über den gesamten Lösungsprozess - von der Strategieentwicklung über die digitale Transformation bis zur operativen Durchführung. Flexibles ArbeitenBei der Planung unserer Projekte berück­sichtigen wir die Lebenssituation unserer Mitarbeiter. Modernste Technologien ermöglichen ein ortsunabhängiges und flexibles Arbeiten. UnternehmenskulturUnsere Kultur ist geprägt von Innovationskraft und Teamgeist sowie vom intensiven Wissens- und Erfahrungsaustausch innerhalb unseres globalen Netzwerks. MarkterfolgWir arbeiten für mehr als 4.000 Kunden in über 120 Ländern, viele davon sind die erfolgreichsten und nam­haftesten Unternehmen ihrer Branche. Darunter 29 der DAX-30-Unternehmen. Frauen bei AccentureSchon heute arbeiten bei Accenture mehr als 145.000 Frauen. Doch wir wollen ihren Anteil bei Neueinstellungen weiter steigern – und das weltweit. Frauen profitieren von speziellen Trainings, Mentorings und Netzwerken. Gesellschaftliche VerantwortungUnser gesellschaftliches Engagement als Unternehmen ist in unseren Grundwerten verankert. Gemeinsam mit unseren Mitarbeitern wollen wir einen nachhaltigen, messbaren Beitrag für die Gesellschaft leisten. Accenture – dein neues berufliches Zuhause Wenn es darum geht, die Leistungsfähigkeit von Unternehmen zu stärken und sie ins digitale Zeitalter zu führen, macht uns niemand so schnell was vor. Als eines der weltweit führenden Dienst­leistungs­unternehmen bieten wir Kunden in mehr als 120 Ländern, darunter die erfolgreichsten und nam­haftesten ihrer Branche, eine breite Palette von Services und Lösungen. In unseren Bereichen Strategy, Consulting, Digital, Technology und Operations treiben wir Innovationen konsequent voran. Was uns einzigartig macht: Wir begleiten den gesamten Lösungsprozess – von der Strategie­entwick­lung über die digitale Transformation bis zur operativen Umsetzung. Mehr erfahren Wir suchen Menschen mit eigenem Lebensentwurf und ungewöhnlichem Lebenslauf. Individuell statt uniform. Vielfalt statt Norm. Diversität ist unsere Stärke und eine wesentliche Komponente der Unternehmenskultur von Accenture. Wir fördern ein integratives und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, in dem sich jeder so zeigen kann, wie er ist. Bei Accenture ist jeder Bewerber willkommen: unabhängig von Herkunft, Nationalität, Glaube, Behinderung, Alter, Familienstand, Partnerschaftsstatus, sexueller Orientierung, Geschlecht und anderen gesetzlich geschützten Gründen.

title: Internship: Full-Stack Software Developer bei Infineon Technologies Austria AG | karriere.at
text:
Internship: Full-Stack Software Developer At a glanceYou love technology, a dynamic environment and want to be part of state-of-the-art developments? At Infineon's Design Center Villach (DCV) we connect the real with the digital world. We focus on the development of circuits that process digital and analog signals. This specific internship is suitable for students within a degree program in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar. In this internship you can bring your programming and databases skills to full use! Curious? Do not hesitate and apply now! Quick infoLocationVillachEntry level0-1 yearJob IDHRC0047558Startas soon as possibleTypeFull time / Part timeContractTemporary
Job descriptionIn order to support internal tool development in our disruptive methodology team, we are searching for the Full-Stack developer. You will work in a multidisciplinary, multicultural environment, very closely with IC design/verification experts, machine learning and data scientist engineers. As an intern, you will work in a team with other developers following scrum methodology. Your task will include: Alignment and refinement of stories Estimation coding Test and review of features You’ll get a chance to work in a dynamic environment where you get the opportunity to enhance your programming skills, get insights into the state-of-the-art semiconductor development flow and get the chance to make a real impact improving it even further. Further InformationType of employment: Temporary / Full-time or Part-time (flexible working hours from Monday to Friday between 6 a.m. and 7 p.m.)Duration: min. 12 months ProfileYou successfully meet the requirements if you are motivated and committed last year Bachelor or Master student from the field of Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar. You are best equipped for this task if you additionally offer: Knowledge in different programming languages, e.g. Type Script, Java Script, SQL, Perl, Python as a plus Basics in databases like SQLite, MySQL Skills in other tools, e.g. ReactJS, Material UI, Redux, ElectronJS, Git, Jira, Linux A self-motivated & proactive working style The ability to be a good team player and the willingness to work in an international team This position is subject to the collective agreement for workers and employees in the electrical and electronics industry (full-time), employment group B for bachelor students, employment group D for master students (https://www.feei.at/wp-content/uploads/2022/05/minimum-salaries-white-collar-workers-2022.pdf). Please attach the following documents (German or English) to your application: Motivation letter CV Certificate of matriculation at a university (you must be enrolled and not on academic leave) Latest Transcript of records (not older than 6 months) Highest completed educational certificate (Matura certificate for Bachelor students, Bachelor certificate for Master students) Reference letter (optional) About UsPart of your life. Part of tomorrow. Infineon is a world leader in semiconductor solutions that make life easier, safer, and greener. Our solutions for efficient energy management, smart mobility, and secure, seamless communications link the real and the digital world. The central R&D organization „Design Enabling and Services“ (DES) provides the design environment to the different Infineon product development teams. With state-of-the-art design methods, building blocks and a wide range of product development services DES supports Infineon's advanced IC development from early high level system models to verified products ready for manufacturing. * The term gender in the sense of the General Equal Treatment Act (GETA) or other national legislation refers to the biological assignment to a gender group. At Infineon we are proud to embrace (gender) diversity, including female, male and diverse. Infineon Hub - Connect. Create. Challenge. The iHub at TU Wien represents an inspiring tech platform, networking area and event location, connecting Infineon Austria with tech experts, science specialists and young professionals. Check out our upcoming events:Infineon iHub Contact UsLisa DerhaschnigStudent Attraction Manager Apply now

title: Data Strategy Manager bei cargo-partner GmbH | karriere.at
text: Data Strategy Manager Fischamend HQ / Full-time / Hybrid APPLY FOR THIS JOB The Data Strategy Manager is an integral part of the Digital Office and closely collaborates with the entire organization, in particular with Directors Corporate Product Management, Corporate Operations Management, Corporate Functions (M&S, Finance, Controlling, HR etc.) as well as IT / Business Intelligence, Digital Business Managers and Customer Experience Specialists to drive the designing, building, and implementation of the cargo-partner Data Strategy that will help enhance operational excellence and competitive / commercial advantage in business. The Data Strategy Manager ensures that the Data Strategy is supporting the achievement of defined corporate business objectives by conducting as-is data capability assessments, formulating relevant data use cases along the customer journey (or operating model), aligning respective priorities and suggesting roadmaps towards a data-driven organization. The role also supports the strategic advice on technological solutions for businesses with the focus on advanced analytics, data platforms & architecture, and data-driven business insights. Responsibilities Define the overall data strategy and evaluate its business impact Work with Digital Business Lead, Digital Business Product Managers and other stakeholders throughout cargo-partner to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive new (digital) or improve existing business solutions. Work with Customer Experience Specialists to identify and drive areas of improvements along the (digital) customer journey and relevant priority touch-points Mine and analyze data from cargo-partner databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies Work with Business and Supporting Unit Leaders to identify opportunities how to improve core revenue and cost drivers through data analytics What we expect Degree (master / diploma) preferably in Quantitative Methods, Business Analytics, Economics, Data Science, Big Data, Computer Science At least five to ten years' practical experience in data strategy and governance, alternatively in data strategy consulting Practical knowledge of tools, frameworks & technologies within at least one of the following categories: Data Strategy (Data Governance, Data Management) Business Intelligence (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Machine Learning (R, Python, SAS, SPSS) Cloud Platforms (Google, Azure, Amazon Web Services) Interested to work not only on delivery of data strategy, but also on business development activities Ready to get things moving? follow us with a hashtags: #cargopartner #workingdigital find out more about our applications: www.spotworx.com www.carrierplatform.com Why cargo-partner: Career plan and professional growth opportunities? We guarantee an individual path of professional development. We give development opportunities in various IT projects. Implementation of own initiatives? Our success is based on team spirit. This is why our colleagues accept responsibility, are always part of the solution, and act as true partners to customers and colleagues alike. Stability of employment? Dynamic work in a stable international company with a leading position in the air and sea freight market. We focus on long-term cooperation. After the project is over, we talk, listen and provide further challenges. Benefits? We provide technical and personal trainings, eLearning, co-financing of language courses and more. Wage (gross): 5000EUR/month *By legal requirement we are providing the information about the basic wage component (minimum salary) for the advertised position. Based on your experience/profile, the final financial conditions will be the subject to discuss and negotiate at the personal interview, however, not less than above mentioned minimum salary component. APPLY FOR THIS JOB

title: Digital Business Manager - Global rate management bei cargo-partner GmbH | karriere.at
text: Digital Business Manager - Global rate management Fischamend HQ / Full-time / Hybrid APPLY FOR THIS JOB Under the guidance of the Corporate Director Operations and Processes (Overseas), the Corporate Director Operations and Processes (Overland) as well as the Chief Digital Officer, will be responsible for leading and coordinating the development and implementation of a global rate management system, standard, process and governance model, allowing cargo-partner to harmonize and standardize the global rate management landscape, improve global rate management productivity, quality and timeliness as well as enable instant, automated and data based quotation management features to our customers. The Digital Business Manager – Global Rate Management will closely collaborate with relevant IT Teams and various other stakeholders (in particular products and BPOs) to understand, analyze and evaluate current state of rate, pricing and quotation management environment and ultimately coordinate the recommendation and implementation of a global rate management concept considering strategic customer and cargo-partner demand. Digital Business Manager – Global Rate Management will drive market research to understand developments in the market and coordinate the Rate Management capability development with internal IT and potentially external vendors. Responsibilities Analyze, evaluate, suggest, implement and govern a globally meaningful rate, pricing and quotation management eco-system / framework for cargo-partner based on relevant parameters like current and future customer segments (demand, behavior etc.), internal operational (product) demand , productivity and data intelligence considerations, as well as industry trends Oversee, direct and lead the global rate management and rate standardization program by developing and introducing a scalable and iterative implementation approach for a global rate management and booking environment to ultimately enable an automated rate management process across the entire cargo-partner customer and operator journey, incl. instant / automated quote & book capability in the DFF customer portal Oversee, direct and lead the development and implementation of a globally standardized rate management and governance process across all relevant products (air, ocean, road and rail), tradelanes and service levels. Drive the evaluation of a required business logic/intelligence layer enhancing the capabilities (shortcomings) of relevant application landscape Wisetech eco-system, aiming at a fully automated, instant and dynamic rate, pricing and quotation management incl. application of behavioral and environmental intelligence in cargo-partners digital customer portal (Digital Freight Forwarder) Oversee and coordinate the evaluation of relevant Rate Management solutions and their capability to offer/support global instant rate, pricing and quotation management Ensure alignment with relevant stakeholders to integrate rate/price /quote information in relevant 3rd party systems like Salesforce Ensure consideration of „innovative technologies“ (AI, Machine Learning, etc.) or alternative business models in automating quoting capabilities based on decided market and customer approach (e.g. for particular customer segments, business types, service levels or rate types) Oversee, direct and lead required transformation activities and timelines related to introduction of new rate management processes, systems and governance Identify and communicate risks/issues proactively to Global Steering Board and respective lead problem solving initiatives What we expect Master degree in business informatics, industrial engineering and / or process engineering or alternatively vocational training with relevant additional management training 5-8 year of experience in freight rate, pricing and/or quotation management and standardization (business and / or application related)5-8 year of experience in program/project and process management type of role. Expertise in BI/ML/AI in relation to Data, Analytics, proactive data driven decision management etc. Experience with analyzing and implementing business transformation projects Exposure to agile/lean methodologies and ways of working is a plus Ready to get things moving? follow us with a hashtags: #cargopartner #workingdigital find out more about our applications: www.spotworx.com www.carrierplatform.com Why cargo-partner: Career plan and professional growth opportunities? We guarantee an individual path of professional development. We give development opportunities in various IT projects. Implementation of own initiatives? Our success is based on team spirit. This is why our colleagues accept responsibility, are always part of the solution, and act as true partners to customers and colleagues alike. Stability of employment? Dynamic work in a stable international company with a leading position in the air and sea freight market. We focus on long-term cooperation. After the project is over, we talk, listen and provide further challenges. Benefits? We provide technical and personal trainings, eLearning, co-financing of language courses and more. Wage (gross): 6500EUR/month *By legal requirement we are providing the information about the basic wage component (minimum salary) for the advertised position. Based on your experience/profile, the final financial conditions will be the subject to discuss and negotiate at the personal interview, however, not less than above mentioned minimum salary component. APPLY FOR THIS JOB

Kapsch TrafficCom Solution Design Engineer (f/m/d) Kapsch TrafficCom develops smart solutions to make mobility safer, more sustainable and efficient for everybody. title: Group Markets Business Development bei Erste Bank | karriere.at
text: Working with us means believing in the future; in the great people who are shaping it together every day and in the wide-ranging career paths it opens up. #believeinyourself Group Markets Business Development Location: Vienna Working-Hours: Full-time Occupation Area: Financial markets Company: Erste Group Bank AG Erste Group was founded in 1819 as the first Austrian savings bank and today it is one of the largest banking groups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE). As an attractive employer, Erste Group offers interesting career opportunities in an international environment. The team Group Markets Business Development provides the divisionalized trading units as well as sales units in Holding with comprehensive data and business analysis which serve for profitability evaluation and decision making. Moreover we are responsible for daily p&l reporting and operative planning of Group Markets result as well as supporting the development of Group Markets strategy. Your Tasks Reporting and analyzing daily financial results of group wide trading and sales business Drawing conclusions on the performance of the business and its drivers Supporting business on deep dive analysis (deal level, products, asset classes, client level, unit level, countries etc.) Driving topic leads and innovation in cooperation with business and our cooperation partners in finance/ risk department, analytics team etc. Handling big data sets derived from a data warehouse, building the bridge between data evaluation and business performance interpretation Your Background At least 3 years experience in the finance sector or capital markets area Comprehensive understanding of trading and sales business activities is of great advantage Strong analytical skills with ability to present and communicate outcomes in a structured way Strong technical capabilities in analysing big data (Python, machine learning course) and basic knowledge in the usage of reporting systems (e.g. XLcubed) Open-minded and pro-active working approach and an ability to drive a topic/change Reliable person with high sense of commitment Very good communication skills in English; basic German is of advantage Our Offer A dynamic and broad business environment in a well experienced and diversified team The possibility to take topic leads, drive the change and grow your personality Discover and enjoy the benefits of Erste Group The minimum wage for this full-time position in accordance with the collective agreement with complete fulfillment of the functional profile is EUR 40.635,84 gross per year. But this is just a formality - we would be happy to talk about your actual salary in person! We offer our employees the opportunity to divide their hours between working from home and at the office. Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin. Apply online Follow us:

title: (Int.) Strategic Business Development Manager (f/m/d) bei A1 Digital International GmbH | karriere.at
text: (Int.) Strategic Business Development Manager (f/m/d) A1 Digital makes digitalization happen. With scalable services and innovative solutions in the areas of IoT, cloud and security, we are the ideal partner for digital projects in medium-sized businesses. A1 Digital currently supports more than 500 companies in their digital transformation. Our experts at our locations in Vienna, Munich and Lausanne are already working with the technologies of tomorrow today. This is a path we can only take together – join in! Location: Austria or Germany Job purpose: We are expanding the Strategy & Business Development team to drive our ambitious growth plans in our core markets Germany and Switzerland, as well as to drive our International Expansion into new Western European markets such as UK, Netherlands, Belgium, Italy and France. To achieve this, we are looking for a tech-savvy, strategically oriented and entrepreneurial personality that is comfortable dealing with executives and is able to identify and develop business opportunities and appreciates creative go-to-market approaches that will drive our high-quality sales pipeline. What you do: Develop a strategic go-to-market plan with the “Head of Strategy & Business Development” in line with the CEO’s ambitious growth plans for your focus areas Identify and develop strategic business opportunities in our core markets Germany and Switzerland as well as selected Western European markets Interact solely with executives to initiate and develop business opportunities as “door opener” before handing them over to our sales team Conceptualize and execute creative marketing campaigns to generate interest of executives in focus industries Run (networking / cocktail / partner) receptions with internal and external executives as well as visit international conferences to represent A1 Digital Work closely with the sales and marketing teams to sync multi-touchpoint campaigns and client interaction What you offer: Min. 5 years of experience in Strategy Consulting, Strategic Marketing/Sales/Business Development and/or entrepreneurial (startup/scale-up etc.) roles with strong IT/technology and marketing/sales focus Strong understanding of major business and digital technology trends related to Cloud, IoT, Machine Learning and Cyber Security Strategic and business (marketing / sales) focused mindset with good understanding of decision-making processes within organizations Experience interacting, impressing and convincing senior executives in business or technology functions Wide network in the digital IT services sector What makes you unique: International experience in various industries and settings Open-minded, cosmopolitan, “easy to talk to” personality Proven track record of marketing/sales focused interaction with top executives What we offer: Competitive compensation package High-growth company setting with unique opportunity to lead market entry in new geographies Flexible working hours, mobile working, sabbatical. Autonomous working conditions with a lot of freedom to create. Modern working atmosphere and centrally located office with great public transport connection. Constant learning with many possibilities and offers. Paid lunch break and cantina, extra holidays, employee rates and many further discounts. Team events as well as trainings and further education The minimum annual gross salary for this position according to the current collective agreement is EUR 48.323,8. The actual annual salary depends on your skills and experience. We at A1 are convinced that women with their ideas and way to work are indispensable for the success of our company and culture. We are therefore pleased about the interest of women in the advertised position and especially invite women to apply. Apply Now

title: Solution Consultant (f/m/d) bei Kapsch TrafficCom | karriere.at
text:
Kapsch TrafficCom Solution Consultant (f/m/d) Kapsch TrafficCom develops smart solutions to make mobility safer, more sustainable and efficient for everybody. We design, build and operate traffic management systems including connected vehicles technology and mobility demand management as well as tolling services for cities, roads, tunnels and bridges around the world. We develop data and video analytics platforms, building on state-of-the-art technologies including AI, machine learning, big data and cloud services to enable the digitalization of mobility.Objective The Solution Sales Consultant adds value by defining the business solution and lifting the capabilities of our Kapsch portfolio of products, solutions and services to support business development and increase revenue generation, based on your strong domain expertise (with focus on either tolling or traffic domain areas).In this role, you will be part of the Sales organization working closely with Sales Managers, Business Development/Partnerships teams throughout the presales process until contract award. You will be joining a small but highly skilled team that helps both our customers and partners to achieve their goals. You will be working closely with Sales Managers to aid in building a pipeline of potential customers, expand our partnerships with new additional partners and increase our win rate.Your ResponsibilitiesServe as regional domain expert and go-to person for industry knowledge and Tolling domain assigned portfolio solutions questions in the region.Trusted advisor and key contributor to our vision and sales strategy to develop new business opportunities in area of expertise.Partner with Sales Managers who build and maintain meaningful relationships with our customers, to drive new business and help our clients in achieving their goals and overcoming their challenges using Kapsch portfolio products, solutions and services.Qualify opportunities, drive and support pre-sales activities and demos.Create compelling presentations and proposals that demonstrate our value proposition against the customer’s required capabilities.Understand our customers’ business requirements and turn them into profitable solutions by driving the definition of customer specific business solution ensuring its technical and commercial adequacyKey contributor to the definition of the bid winning strategy and solution, ensuring those goals are met, especially during handover from pre-sales to bid phase and throughout bid phase.Contribute to regional market intelligence by identifying industry and technology trends, competitors analysis and potential customer groups and feedback to Portfolio Product Management and Sales Management.Provide internal and external thought leadership by speaking and participating in industry events and conferences.Product innovator building a product feedback loop, with Product Managers, from frequent customer interactions, contributing with input into future product and service offerings for the Europe, Middle East and North African market.Your ProfileYou have a background in ITS industry. You are a people person who can get other’s buy in. You’re curious, cooperative, solution and service oriented and persuasive with your arguments.Skills and ExperienceM.Sc or B.Sc in technology.3+ years of experience in a customer facing role such as Technical Sales, Solution Consulting or Sales Engineering and in technical pre-sales of complex systems/solutions within ITS, with main focus on Tolling Solutions.5-10 years’ experience preferably from a technical position and then moved in to sales or customer success projects.Strong experience in consulting skills (e.g. strategic, technological) and balance between a service driven and sales mindset.Demonstrate a very high degree of technical understanding, analytical and strategic thinking, and collaborative leadership.Strong understanding of current and emerging Tolling and Intelligent Transportation (ITS) Solutions for the European ITS/ETC market with strong knowledge of back office systems, both technically and commercially with electronic vehicle, satellite tolling and congestion charging as a plus.Goal oriented candidate with real passion for technology, solutions and our business with high desire, commitment and motivation.Analytical nature and ability of conceptual thinking and solving complex business issues within the context of the solution expertise.Storyteller and Visualizer - able to communicate in a simple and compelling way.Ability to work multiple opportunities and engage with many customers concurrently.Strong negotiation and influencing skills and ability to work with different teams within the organization.Network of industry contacts and participation in industry associations.Strong interpersonal skills with passion to drive collaboration and deliver high-quality across an international team.Exceptional written, verbal communication and presentation skills.Experience in adapting and presenting to a wide audience, from executives, senior decision makers to technical departments.Available and enjoy travelling and meeting with internal and external stakeholders.Excellent business process and/or project experience using tools such as Visio, MS Project, MS Word, MS Excel, etc.Excellent oral and written English, additional languages a plus (e.g. German, Dutch, French, Spanish, Polish, Slavic, Scandinavian).Why should you work for Kapsch TrafficCom ITS is one the most dynamic and fast-growing industries which is undergoing a major transformation driven by autonomous and connected vehicles.Kapsch is among the thought leaders of that transformation. We are building on a sound present business – Kapsch is the global market leader in large-scale tolling systems and traffic management – and are in parallel strongly investing into the future green and sustainable technologies.If you join us now you will be part of this exciting endeavor.We are an international company with European roots.We have a unique corporate culture, driven by family tradition since 1892.We strive to create a work environment conducive to personal growth, satisfaction and achievement.We work in line with our corporate values: respect, responsibility, performance, dynamic, freedom, transparency, discipline, family.Social benefits of a modern company, e.g. Homeoffice, mobile devices, flexible working hours (at the headquarters in Vienna: operating restaurants, meal discount, near subway etc.)Location is flexible - preferred ViennaStart date: as soon as possible, full-time positionKapsch is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We attach great importance to a balance in the diversity of our employees. Therefore we welcome all applications without regard to gender, age, religious beliefs/ideology, sexual orientation, ethnicity or national origin.
